abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Background</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Novel biomarkers for personalizing anticoagulation remain undetermined. We aimed to investigate the association of plasma miRNAs with pharmacokinetic–pharmacodynamic (PK-PD) profiles of rivaroxaban.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Methods</jats:title>
                <jats:p>This is a multicenter, exploratory study of miRNAs in a Chinese population. Healthy volunteers and patients receiving rivaroxaban were enrolled in the study. The area under the plasma concentration–time curve from time 0-t h (AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub>) and anti-Xa activity at 3 h (AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub>) were measured in healthy volunteers, and AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub> was measured in patients. MiRNAs were detected by miRNA microarray in 26 healthy volunteers with 20 mg rivaroxaban, and quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction was used to exclude undetectable ones. MiR-320a-3p and miR-483-5p were then quantified in 65 healthy volunteers and 71 patients. MiRNA levels at 3 h were compared between high and low AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub> or AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub> subjects and in matched patients with or without bleeding during follow-up. The miRNA targets were predicted by TargetScan, miRTarBase, and miRDB. Validated genes were included in GO enrichment and KEGG analyses. The protein–protein interaction network was established by STRING and visualized by Cytoscape.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Results</jats:title>
                <jats:p>A total of 136 Chinese subjects completed the study. In healthy volunteers taking 15 mg rivaroxaban, the miR-320a level at 3 h was significantly positively correlated with AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub> and AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub> (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic> = 0.359, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 0.025; <jats:italic>r</jats:italic> = 0.370, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 0.02, respectively). A positive correlation was also observed between miR-483 and AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub> or AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub> (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic> = 0.372, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 0.02; <jats:italic>r</jats:italic> = 0.523, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic> = 0.001, respectively). MiR-320a and miR-483 levels at 3 h in the higher AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub> group were significantly higher than those at 0 h. MiR-483 levels at 3 h may distinguish healthy volunteers with high or low AXA<jats:sub>3h</jats:sub> or AUC<jats:sub>0-t</jats:sub>. In the 10 mg fed subgroup, higher 3 h mir-483 levels were also observed compared with the control group. No significant differences were found in the comparisons among patients. Bioinformatic analysis showed that these miRNAs may play a regulatory role by targeting ABCG2, ITGB3, PTEN, MAPK1/3, etc.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Conclusions</jats:title>
                <jats:p>MiR-320a and miR-483 levels were found to be associated with PK and PD profiles of rivaroxaban in healthy Chinese subjects. Further studies are required to verify these findings and explore the mechanisms.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec>

group.label: Ethics approval and consent to participate

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The protocol was approved by an independent ethics committee and the Institutional Review Board of Peking University First Hospital and all participating research subcentral hospitals. The trial registration number is NCT03161496. All subjects were enrolled in this study after signing informed consent.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All authors of this paper consent for publishing the manuscript and figures in the journal.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The authors declare that they have no competing interests.
